instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15 no GPU core
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15  no liquid damage, <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> is about 60mv, I replaced <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> but no changes.

Macbook boots os fine, keyboard backlight turns and I can hear OS sound, but there is no backlight and no video.

<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.25v
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_PGOOD</SIGNAL> is 3.2v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15 no GPU core
threads.message: customer send me this picture that show initial problem, now I revived it it has no video.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15 no GPU core
threads.message: Unplug display and try external only, also try another display assembly...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15 no GPU core
threads.message: obviously I already tried woking display but no changes. There is no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL>, I can't get video without vcore. Could you help me to diagnose Gpu vcore problem?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15 no GPU core
threads.message: There will be no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> while booted in OSX as it will be running on Intel GFX. Is <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> present when it is just powered on without being booted?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 15 no GPU core
threads.message: I fixed by replacing lcd and clearing pads under <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, probably Chinese refurbished lcd screen is not good quality as original one and caused artifacts or no signal.
